page.title: 01West of Chesham Bois (pt 1)
page.content: This area of Southern England is situated approximately thirty miles West North West of London forming part of the capital's commuter belt. As part of the Chiltern Hills it lies in the Southern half of the county of Buckinghamshire. Within the area surveyed there are the villages of Hyde Heath and Little Missenden, together with the outer suburbs of two market towns, Chesham and Amersham. Between these settlements are extensive areas of good quality, extensively cultivated cereal and grass land. Amid the typical, undulating chalk landscape there are numerous patches of woodland. Some are natural deciduous, including the Beech tree, others are coniferous plantations, often occupying steep valley sides and hilltop sites.
